title: NBA Daily Rundown
subtitle: February 11, 2026: Trade Buzz, Star Injuries, and Wembanyama's Dominance!

items.headline: LeBron's All-NBA Streak Ends as Lakers Duo Sidelined
items.summary: LeBron James was sidelined against the Spurs with left foot arthritis, missing his 18th game this season and ending his remarkable 21-year streak of All-NBA team eligibility due to the 65-game rule. Teammate Luka Dončić also sat out his third straight game with a left hamstring strain.

items.headline: Deni Avdija Makes Triumphant Return for Blazers
items.summary: Israeli forward Deni Avdija returned to action for the Portland Trail Blazers on February 9th, shaking off a back ailment to post an impressive 26 points, 10 rebounds, and 8 assists in a 135-118 victory over the Philadelphia 76ers.

items.headline: Major Moves Shake Up League Post-Trade Deadline
items.summary: The recent NBA trade deadline saw significant shake-ups, including Anthony Davis heading to the Washington Wizards, James Harden joining the Cleveland Cavaliers, and Nikola Vučević moving to the Boston Celtics. Anfernee Simons and Jaden Ivey were traded to the Chicago Bulls, while Coby White landed with the Charlotte Hornets. Rumors about Ja Morant and Giannis Antetokounmpo staying with their respective teams also dominated the buzz.

items.headline: Pacers Edge Knicks in OT Thriller
items.summary: Indiana Pacers outlasted the New York Knicks in an overtime battle.

items.headline: Rockets Take Down Clippers
items.summary: Houston Rockets secured a solid win over the Los Angeles Clippers.

items.headline: Suns Shine Bright Against Mavericks
items.summary: Phoenix Suns defeated the Dallas Mavericks.

items.headline: Wemby Drops 40 as Spurs Dominate Shorthanded Lakers
items.summary: Victor Wembanyama's explosive 40-point performance led the San Antonio Spurs to a commanding victory over an injury-depleted Los Angeles Lakers squad.

items.headline: Wemby's Career Night
items.summary: Victor Wembanyama erupted for a season-high 40 points, adding 12 rebounds, 2 steals, and 1 block in just 26 minutes during the Spurs' rout of the Lakers on February 10th.

items.headline: Avdija's Big Return
items.summary: Deni Avdija showcased an all-around performance in his return for the Trail Blazers on February 9th, recording 26 points, 10 rebounds, and 8 assists against the 76ers.

items.headline: Camara Catches Fire
items.summary: Toumani Camara exploded for a career-high 30 points, hitting 8-of-10 from beyond the arc for the Trail Blazers in their victory over the 76ers on February 9th.

items.headline: Brunson's Scoring Spree
items.summary: Jalen Brunson poured in 40 points, along with 8 assists and 5 rebounds for the Knicks in their overtime loss to the Pacers on February 10th.

items.headline: Hart's Triple-Double
items.summary: Josh Hart notched his second triple-double of the season with 15 points, 11 rebounds, and 11 assists for the Knicks against the Pacers on February 10th.

items.headline: Spurs' Stephon Castle Exits Game with Pelvis Contusion
items.summary: San Antonio Spurs' second-year guard Stephon Castle suffered a pelvis contusion against the Lakers on February 10th and was ruled out for the remainder of the game. X-rays reportedly came back negative.

items.headline: Star Players Out for February 11th Games
items.summary: Several key players are out for tonight's matchups, including Giannis Antetokounmpo (MIL - right calf strain), Evan Mobley (CLE - left calf strain), Max Strus (CLE - left foot surgery), Trae Young (WAS - right MCL sprain/quad contusion), Anthony Davis (WAS - left finger sprain), D'Angelo Russell (WAS - not with team), and Coby White (CHA - left calf strain).

items.headline: Warriors Eye Eric Gordon in Buyout Market
items.summary: The Golden State Warriors are reportedly looking to strengthen their bench via the buyout market, with veteran guard Eric Gordon emerging as a potential target if he clears waivers after his situation changed at the trade deadline.

items.headline: Current NBA Statistical Leaders
items.summary: As of February 11th, Luka Dončić leads the league in points per game (32.8 PPG), Karl-Anthony Towns is the rebounds per game leader (11.9 RPG), and Cade Cunningham tops the assists per game category (9.6 APG).
